metadata.title: CVE-2020-36323 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the standard library in Rust before 1.52.0, there is an optimization forjoining strings that can cause uninitialized bytes to be exposed (or theprogram to crash) if the borrowed string changes after its length ischecked.

criterions.comment: rustc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
